H0.text: Animals adapt to new environments is the principle that explains why, when 500 flies of one species were sprayed with a new insecticide and nearly all died after 24â€¯hours, a few survived.

H1.text: New species develop from survivors is the principle that best explains why, after spraying 500 flies of one species with a new insecticide, nearly all were dead after 24 hours but a few survived.

H2.text: There is variation among individuals within a species explains why, of the 500 flies sprayed with a new insecticide, nearly all died after 24 hours while a few survived.

H3.text: Insecticides may cause genetic mutations, which explains why, among 500 flies of one species sprayed with a new insecticide, a few survived 24 hours later while nearly all others were dead.

A4.text: without phenotypic variation, there would be no evolution by natural selection.

A5.text: the switch from light to dark coloration is due to a transposable element insertion into the first intron of the gene cortex.
